oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A bound on the chromatic number using the longest odd cycle length
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KENKRE, S
VISHWANATHAN, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: graphs
graph coloring
chromatic number
odd cycles
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Let G be a non-bipartite graph with l as the length of the longest odd cycle. Erdos and Hajnal proved that chi(G) <= l + 1. We show that the only graphs for which this is tight are those that contain Kl+1 and further, if G does not contain K-l then chi(G) <= l - 1. We then extend these results and show that if we exclude a large clique, we can prove better bounds for chi(G) as a function of l. Specifically, we show that if omega(G) <= inverted right perpendicular l(1 - epsilon)inverted left perpendicular for epsilon <= 4/15, then chi(G) <= inverted right perpendicular l(1 - epsilon/2)inverted left perpendicular. (C) 2006 .
